nio/CounterIntervalSimulator.description: Simulates and emits a signal every [interval] seconds.

attr_name.title: Simulated Attribute
attr_name.description: The name of the simulated signal attribute.

attr_value.title: Simulated Value
attr_value.description: The value assigned to the simulated attribute.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: How often to emit generated signals.

num_signals.title: Number of Signals
num_signals.description: The amount of signals to emit at each interval.

total_signals.title: Total Number of Signals
total_signals.description: The maximum number of signals to emit overall after the service starts. If less than 0 (-1 by default), then the trigger will continue to emit signals indefinitely until the block is stopped.

nio/CounterSafeSimulator.description: Simulates and emits a signal every [interval] seconds, even if not all signals have been simulated.  If the 'max_count' is too high, the block will emit a signal with however many signals it was able to create during the defined interval.

attr_name.title: Simulated Attribute
attr_name.description: The name of the simulated signal attribute.

attr_value.title: Simulated Value
attr_value.description: The value assigned to the simulated attribute.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: How often to emit generated signals.

max_count.title: Max Count
max_count.description: Maximum signals to emit. The block will never emit more signals than this count every interval. If the number is too high for it to create, it may emit less than this number. The only guarantee made by this block is that a notification will happen every interval.

nio/FileIntervalSimulator.description: Creates signals as defined by a json file. The file must be a list of dictionaries where each dictionary is a nio Signal. The file should be loadable using `json.load`.  Each call to generate_signals will return a signal from the list loaded in from the json file.  When asked to generate -1 signals, it will generate all signals in the file.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: How often to emit generated signals.

num_signals.title: Number of Signals
num_signals.description: How many signals get notified at once.

random_selection.title: Choose Randomly?
random_selection.description: Whether or not to randomly pull from the file. If unchecked, the simulator will iterate through the file sequentially.

signals_file.title: Signals File
signals_file.description: The location of the file containing a list of signals. It can be an absolute file location, relative to the root project directory or relative to the block path.

total_signals.title: Total Number of Signals
total_signals.description: The maximum number of signals to emit overall. If less than 0 (-1 by default), then the trigger will continue to emit indefinitely until the block is stopped.

nio/IdentityCronSimulator.description: Simulate and emit signals according to a cron-like timetable

cron.title: Cron Schedule
cron.description: The time (UTC) at which to emit the simulated signals.

num_signals.title: Number of Signals
num_signals.description: How many signals get notified at once.

utc.title: UTC
utc.description: Use UTC time or local time.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: How often to emit generated signals.

num_signals.title: Number of Signals
num_signals.description: How many signals get notified at once.

total_signals.title: Total Number of Signals
total_signals.description: The maximum number of signals to emit overall. If less than 0 (-1 by default), then the trigger will continue to emit indefinitely until the block is stopped.
